script.line: Prota! What brings you all the way out here to my landfill? Shoppin' for some vintage threads?
Oh, hey Randi! I'm looking for my dog, Minty. She ran away this morning.
I was hoping maybe you'd spotted her?
Hmmm... Nah, I'm afraid I ain't seen hide nor hair o' the ol' girl.
Okay. Well, I guess I'll keep looking then. Thanks anyway.
Now hang on a second there, Prota! Just 'cause I ain't seen your dog, don't mean I can't help!
Cause if I'm bein' truthful, I think you're goin' 'bout this dog-findin' thing all wrong!
...Really?
Yeah! Look at you. You're comin' to the landfill, sniffin' around for a little dog.
Like lookin' for a needle in a haystack! That's crazy!
You can't expect to find Minty if you're just gonna use those fleshy little orbs you call eyes!
Pardon me?
I know, I know, Vintage Viper like me s'posed to be old-fashioned, real traditional...
...and reverent towards our soft mortal bodies.
But welcome to the future, Prota!
Everything's smart now. And if you want to really look for your dog, you need help.
You need...
ROBOT EYES.
I said "You need ROBOT EYES."
No, I heard you.
Well fortunately for you, Prota, the landfill's got everything you need!
Here you can build the coolest, most tricked-out, kickbuttenest robot the world's ever seen.
You just need to go out and find a head, a body, and some legs...
And I'll help you build the Minty-Finder 3000.
With futuristic laser eyes on our side...
...we'll track that dog down in two shakes of a robot lamb's metal tail.
Hmmm. That would be nice. Can't say I've had the best luck with new inventions today, but...
I'll start looking right away! You know what they say: always dive in head first!
